intro: Carallia montana, commonly known as the mountain beauty or red mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy red flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Carallia montana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
